RBT

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • RBT.Table

  • public class Table
extends Object
    Loads or generates a rainbow table, given expected parameters in Config object. Also contains static Table helper functions.
    Author:
    Chris Cameron
    See Also:
    Config, Search

      • byteArrayToHexString

        Credit to: https://stackoverflow.com/a/311179/3846437
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Hex string of 40-characters

      • hexStringToByteArray

        protected static byte[] hexStringToByteArray(String s)
        Converts a hex string representing an SHA-1 hash to a byte[]. This is compatible with what MessageDigest.digest() returns.
        Parameters:
        s - Hex string of 40-characters
        Returns:
        byte[] of length 20
        See Also:
        MessageDigest.digest()

      • createShaHash

        protected static byte[] createShaHash(String plaintext)
        Creates an SHA-1 hash of supplied string in byte[] form. Uses MessageDigest.digest().
        Parameters:
        plaintext - String to hash
        Returns:
        byte[] of length 20
        See Also:
        MessageDigest.digest()

      • hashToHashStep

        protected static byte[] hashToHashStep(byte[] initialHash,
                                       int n,
                                       int cl,
                                       int kl)
        Reduce then hash, n times. Static version.
        This method takes a hash, treats it as if it were at some location on a chain, and then runs it along the chain until the final position.
        So, consider steps ('n') to be counted from the right side of the chain.

        For example, with a chain of - K1:H1:K2:H2:K3:H3:...:K10:H10 n = 3 would be three in from the right. This places 'plaintext' at the position of hashToKey(hash, 6, 5), or the 7th chain from the left in a chain of length 10. salt = 10 - 3 - 1 = 6

        Parameters:
        initialHash - Starting hash value
        n - Number of times to hash, reduce
        cl - Chain length
        kl - Key length
        Returns:
        Hash in byte[] form that is 'n' steps from 'initialHash'

      • hashToKey

        protected static String hashToKey(byte[] hash,
                                  int salt,
                                  int kl)
        Hash reduction algorithm. Produces different result for the same hash depending on supplied salt. Static version.
        When considered against the *Step() methods, this could be considered a single step.
        Parameters:
        hash - Hash in byte[] form
        salt - int that acts as modifier to method's output
        kl - Key length
        Returns:
        Plain-text key

      • isValidHexHash

        protected static boolean isValidHexHash(String hash)
        Performs basic checks that the supplied hash is valid.
        Parameters:
        hash - Supplied hash as 40-character hex string
        Returns:
        Validity of hash

      • keyToKeyStep

        protected static String keyToKeyStep(String initialKey,
                                     int n,
                                     int cl,
                                     int kl)
        Hash, reduce, n times, along a chain that starts with initialKey. Static version.
        'n' is a location on the chain, when counting from left to right, which should point to the location of a target key (which isn't held in this method). The intent is that, given the head of the chain, 'initialKey', 'n' steps in will be the particular key that the caller is looking for.
        Parameters:
        initialKey - Initial plain-text key
        n - Number of times to hash, reduce
        cl - Chain length
        kl - Key length
        Returns:
        Result of 'n' hash, reduce steps
